Nihilism comes from the Latin root for nothing (which can be found in annihilate or floccinaucinihilipilification). This philosophy is the belief that nothing matters and that existence is meaningless. Cynicism comes from the Greek word for dog, as the practitioners would behave like a dog. They believed that social values were useless and that we should turn to nature instead. Whereas Nihilism completely rejects all meaning, Cynicism merely surrenders social, urbane interaction. However, they both involve ignoring others’ opinions. Nihilists do not care what other people think as with the Cynics.
